Welcome to Text-to-First-Letters, by Geoff Hom!
This app shows the first letter of each word in a given text. You can see this now by tapping "First Letters" (bottom of the screen).
One use for this app is to help you memorize a text.
To see an example, tap "Texts" (upper-right).
Geoff may be reached at geoffhom@gmail.com.

To get a feel for this app, try to memorize these words: "Four score and seven years ago, our fathers brought forth, on this continent, a new nation, conceived in liberty, and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal."
Switch between first letters and full text by tapping "First Letters" and "Full Text" (bottom of the screen). Alternatively, you may pinch in/out on the screen.
To increase or decrease the font size, tap "Font Size" (upper-right).
To add your own text, tap "Add a Text" (upper-left). You will immediately be given a new text. To switch back to this example, tap "Texts" (upper-right).
To edit the title/words of a text, tap "Edit Text" (lower-right).
To delete a text, tap the Trash Can (lower-left). You will have to make a second tap to delete the text, so feel free to try it.
